intro: Pavetta travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
